text: TOKYO Japanese Prime Minister Yoshihide Suga will travel to the United States to meet President Joe Biden next month to discuss Indo-Pacific issues, Japans chief government spokesman said on Friday.Suga will go to the U.S. in the first half of April and will become the first foreign leader to meet face-to-face with President Biden, Chief Cabinet Secretary Katsunobu Kato told reporters.The leaders meeting is intended to show their strong commitment to a free and fair Indo-Pacific region, Kato said.
